Header: Pared-down Dior collection lifts the veil on Haute Couture
Content: Dior presented a deliberately paired-down Haute Couture collection in Paris, in what the house’s head designer said was a focus on craftsmanship over flashy fashion. Models wandered calmly through an all-white showroom-turned-catwalk which was lined with mannequins wearing prototypes from the collection, a glimpse behind the scenes. Only a handful of houses are officially allowed to style themselves “Haute Couture” with a number of major brands including Louis Vuitton and Saint Laurent absent from the club.
